title: ORA accesses non-URL, and signals foreseeable(?) error

labels.name: RIA/ORA
labels.description: Issues related to RIA-based workflows and related components

body:
```
% datalad clone https://github.com/psychoinformatics-de/studyforrest-data-retinotopy.git
[INFO   ] Remote origin not usable by git-annex; setting annex-ignore                                                       
[INFO   ] https://github.com/psychoinformatics-de/studyforrest-data-retinotopy.git/config download failed: Not Found        
[INFO   ] [INFO] Fetching 'http://studyforrest.ds.inm7.de/ria-layout-version' 
[INFO   ] Failed to establish a new session 1 times. Last exception was: ConnectionError(HTTPConnectionPool(host='studyforrest.ds.inm7.de', port=80): Max retries exceeded with url: /ria-layout-version (Caused by NewConnectionError('<urllib3.connection.HTTPConnection object at 0x7f46ea092ac0>: Failed to establish a new connection: [Errno -2] Name or service not known'))) 
install(ok): /tmp/studyforrest-data-retinotopy (dataset)
```

Importantly, there is no actual error. This is only exposing internal handling.

Ping @bpoldrack
